name: 7 Hotel Diner

reviews.text: A simple premise with great service. Very friendly and helpful staff. Great breakfast. Only issue was the additional cost of breakfast on the bill after the stay as there was an apparent budget on breakfast for B&B guests. A separate breakie menu for guests would have been a simple solution. Only found out on check-out.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Reception and restaurant staff where very friendly, polite and effecifient at all times.
reviews.title: Our overnight in the 7 hotel diner

reviews.text: The hotel is very clean and complimented with nice room with a powerful shower.. We had a fantastic breakfast.
reviews.title: Nice room...food could be a lot better and warmer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well done all would definately stay there again
reviews.title: Fun place to stay: not five stay, but well worth the visit

reviews.text: Brian and gillian
reviews.title: Everything takes ages.
Pleasantly surprised
reviews.text: Having read some of the reviews on TA, I was apprehensive about our overnight stay on 4 Jan. However everything was fine, room very clean and comfortable. The only niggles were that the bathroom radiator was scaldingly hot and there were no tea bags or spoons provided with the coffee; otherwise it was more than acceptable. Our experience in the Diner both for afternoon tea and breakfast was excellent with attentive service and good food. The receptionist was extremely helpful too. All in all we would recommend.
We stayed her with a group of University friends who were all invited to a 60th birthday party.
reviews.title: friendly and pleasant

reviews.text: the checking in was friendly and efficient. the receptionist was very helpful and ordered a taxi for 5 people to get us to the venue.
reviews.title: Fun, friendly, flexible & def a place I'd go back to :)

reviews.text: The rooms were very small and we barely had room to move and kept bumping into the wooden edges of the bed. the bathroom was also very cramped and would not have suited a large person in the shower.
reviews.title: Poor room cleanliness, terrible diner cleanliness

reviews.text: however, the rooms were clean and adequate. this was compensated by the great breakfast in the diner where we had a lovely breakfast with endless cups of coffee. the staff were friendly and did not rush us as we sat in the diner for hours talking to friends that we had not seen for ages.
reviews.title: Reception lady fab....... But

reviews.text: I stayed here just one night. No complaints about the hotel. The diner on the other hand leaves little to be desired. The food is average at best, the service is appalling. We had a large group, but they had a week warning we were coming for breakfast. After 75 minutes, still no breakfast when most everyone ordered the same thing. My scrambled eggs came on top of my pancakes which left them a soggy mess. About 1/4 of the orders were incorrect and when a couple joined us slightly later, it took nearly 45 minutes and three trips to the counter to get a cup of tea. The problem was with the server (yes one server), we were across several tables yet instead of treating us as small groups of 5-6 each, she tried to serve us as one large group which didn't work. People at the same table were done with their plates while the person next to them still had to wait 10-30 minutes for their food. A disorganized mess. My friend ate dinner there the prior evening and had already commented how bad the service was then, so it's not a one-off thing, they really need to rethink their system as it's not working as it is now.
reviews.title: 5* for hotel, 1* for diner

reviews.text: One night stay in the 7 Hotel Diner as attending a wedding nearby, I say nearby, the 7 Hotel Diner feels like it's in the middle of nowhere! Hotel: a friend and I booked a twin room and were given a family room, 1 single, 1 double bed. This wasn't an issue and the room and bathroom were clean, beds were clean/freshly made and a kettle was provided. However, the lighting in the room and bathroom was terrible-it was predominately spotlights which made the room very dark in places. The hotel staff were very helpful though, delivering a hairdryer to the room minutes after it was requested and arranging taxi's to and from the wedding venue. We paid £89 for one night including breakfast.
reviews.title: Hotel, fine. Diner, never again.

reviews.text: As we were not the only members of the wedding party staying at the hotel the bride and groom had pre warned the diner that there would be approximately 20 people coming for breakfast the following morning including some guests of the hotel. They had allocated us a large space which was great however the service for breakfast was TERRIBLE. The wait staff were beyond incompetent. It appeared we had been allocated one waitress who seemed to be on another planet and had trouble remembering an order of 4 coffees and 1 tea. There seemed to be no logical order in her taking our orders, getting the requests to the kitchen and getting the food out to us. There isn't an incredible amount to choose from on the breakfast menu so everyone had pretty much the same order yet those who ordered first didn't get theior food until last and the orders were mixed up/incorrect when delivered. Minimum wait for food was easily half an hour minimum and it wasn't particularly warm on arrival, this was also the case for a cup of tea for one of the guests. No apologies from the wait staff instead they chose to blame the chef or lack of one, however it wasn't the chef taking the orders! More wait staff appeared but things didn't really improve. The manager didn't apologise either also citing staff pressures. Forgive me for thinking that an apology, even if you don't really mean it, is just common courtesy. Due to the terrible service we requested a discount in the bill and were given 20% off as a result of our complaints. This did not apply however to those of us who had paid for breakfast as part of our room rate. This was not a one off on this weekenfd as the service in the diner was just as dire the afternoon before with having to request to be seated, ask for a menu and ask for tthe bill twice and this was one person eating alone in a predominately empty diner!
reviews.title: Relaxed atmosphere friendly staff

reviews.text: We have just come back from a 3 night stay at the 7 hotel diner we had a really relaxed few days. We had bed and breakfast which was really nice £10 per head per day for breakfast which is included in the overall stay price which we think was more than adequate for the portion size. Nice comfortable clean room with a great shower. We couldn't hear any road noise with the windows shut as we were at the back of the hotel although not great if your look for a view with your room. Thank you for a lovely stay
reviews.title: Clean, friendly well appointed ...

reviews.text: Functional, well appointed and good value with great personal service ... however rooms at the front are quite noisy with the traffic .... restaurant not much to write home about, however an excellent Indian restaurant next door (The Calcutta Club).
reviews.title: A little gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my partner checked in on saturday and was greeted by a very smiley, pretty young girl on recepetion. After we had checked in we went up to our room which was very welcoming, warming and in comforatable surroundings, we especially loved the tv and shower. We then came down later to the diner for a drink and were sat in the lounge and was served by a young lady called lacy. The diner had a buzzing atmosphere and we could see a party at the back who were all dressed up as characters from Grease. It was all very nice to see a theme of the diner for a party....i wish i had my pink ladies jacket with me lol. When we came back later that evening we were greeted again in a very polite manner by the diner manager. After one of the best sleeps in a very long time, 4 kids say no more, we ventured down to the diner for our breakfast, we were greeted by the diner manager who was working last night, he was very friendly and smiley, even though he must'nt have had any more than 6 hours sleep. We were sat in the window on a booth which was really comfortable and after having a good look around the decor itself is WOW, this place does have that factor and originality that so many other places lack. Our waitress Nikki took our order, after a few minutes our coffee turned up but we had to ask for our orange juice to which she apologised and got for us. The breakfast which was a full english and a salmon and eggs was dbl WOW, the breakfast was hot, with a gorgeous tasting sausage, and heinz beans!! only thing is the bacon was a litle not to my partners tasting, as it looked like it had been boiled and was a bit too smoked, the salmon and eggs was scrumptious, i love the use of cream in the eggs, im going to be doing that at home now. One observation we did make is that the kitchen did seem a little all over the place, at one point there were 5 chefs behind the counter, i did see the diner manager go round and kick them out into the back area. All in all an amazing experience and we will bi highly recommending the hotel and the diner to all of our family and friends, we hope to be seeing you again soon, Sue and Keith.
reviews.title: All i can say is WOW!

reviews.text: My company booked this hotel for me for 4 nights, however after the third night I moved out and went to the Best western Donnington Manor so I could finally sleep. The problem with this hotel is the cleaning of the restaurant in the middle of the night. From 2 AM till 4 AM there is the sound of moving furniture and vacuum cleaning.
reviews.title: good food, friendly staff, very very noisy sleeping

reviews.text: I stayed at the 7 Hotel Diner for 6 months as part of my work. It was a brilliant hotel that went above and beyond the port of call. They go out of their way to make sure that you have everything you need and the service is excellent, friendly and warm. They put on special events for me and my work collegues on our birthdays and leaving do's with fantastic cocktails and lovely food. They have vintage car shows, with Elvis impersonators, line dancing and all the 50's get up. If you need anything at all, you just have to ask and they will try their hardest to get it for you.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are modern and spacious with great TVs and powerful showers. The rooms are always clean and are cleaned daily if you require it. The free Wifi is excellent and has great signal throughout the hotel. They even have DVD players and DVDs that can be rented for a very reasonable price.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great position, great breakfast

reviews.text: All the staff are great and I have gotten to know them all very well during my stay. Matt, Aiden, Digby and Steve the managers are always trying to keep us entertained with DVD nights especially when we were snowed in for 3 days. They are always dreaming up new cocktails and meals for us to try and always have a smile on their faces.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: So, if you're looking for a comfortable hotel with authentic 50's food, modern rooms, great entertainment and friendly faces, the 7 hotel diner is the place for you. i hope you enjoy your stay as much as I did.
reviews.title: Great place for food and for the hotel also

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks guys, you were all incredible.
reviews.title: Lots Of Fun

reviews.text: Better than a mindless consistant, Premier Inn-like Chain? Yes
reviews.title: The Same in a Different Way

reviews.text: Worth paying a lot more money for? No
reviews.title: American-style food, but British-style service

reviews.text: Different, stylish, 50's Americana throughout with enough nice touches
reviews.title: Great themed Resturant

reviews.text: (bathroom mirror anyone?) to keep you amused.
reviews.title: wedding

reviews.text: Front of the hotel has traffic noise, it would seem.
reviews.title: Lively stop on a Business trip

reviews.text: Excellent value. Clean, comfortable room. Absolutely no complaints. Staff very helpful & friendly.
reviews.title: Nice surprise.

reviews.text: I found this hotel to be a very nice surprise. I was a little nervous at staying at a 'themed' hotel, but I can honestly say it exceeded expectations.
reviews.title: Nice surprise

reviews.text: The staff were friendly, and the rooms were very clean - that even the Hotel Inspector would be pleased! The rooms were modern, light and airy. A small en suite shower room, but perfectly adequate - with lovely smelling toiletries.
reviews.title: Clean, friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Refreshments and kettle in room - however kettle had water in from previous occupant, which could have been included on the housekeeping check list, and no biscuits.
reviews.title: Convenient and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good dressing table and big mirror, and above a decent sized flat screen Samsung TV with wakeup alarm.
reviews.title: Great fun hotel and restaurant

reviews.text: Stayed here one nightwhen away on business. Usually stay in Premier Inn or Holiday Inn Express but this was much better. Really beautiful room, warm, quiet and comfy bed. Both breakfast and dinner broght to my room - anything I liked from the menu. Staff very friendly and helpful. Free Wifi very useful. Meeting room was available too. Will definitely stay again if in the area.
reviews.title: Very good Value

reviews.text: This hotel/diner is American themed. Rooms are very clean, modern and warm. All staff were very helpful and friendly. Excellent that the diner is part of the hotel, food was fantastic, ate until stuffed!! Thoroughly recommend a stay here and will be staying again soon. Situated on a busy road, but rooms double glazed abd could not hear traffic. No baths in rooms and I dont like showers, but this shower was powerful and hot, even I was converted!
reviews.title: Lovely Place

reviews.text: Some time ago I read a write up about this place in the Observer so made a note of it to stay the next time I was working in Kent. So glad I did as its lovely - the rooms are very nicely furnished with comfy beds, modern decor, big screen tvs & good bathrooms. My only slight gripe would be that my room was at the end of the corridor (208) & the entry door to the corridor bangs when it shuts making my room door rattle. This wasnt a problem on the night, but in the morning it did wake me up early - the corridor door just needs a slow closing hinge put on it. Everything else was great though & the staff are very friendly & helpful. Its very quirky which I like & I went into the diner for dinner & this is just as quirky! The food was fantastic - proper American style food, including the breakfast the next morning. I really cant fault it - they even filled my thermos up with coffee in the morning when I asked them. I will definately stay here again & even when I'm working in Essex as its right off Jt 4 of the M25 so handy for everywhere.
reviews.title: Lovely Find

reviews.text: This is a very nice clean and modern/retro hotel. I booked it on line and was offered a full English Breakfast with my booking.
reviews.title: Nice hotel confused about it's prices

reviews.text: On arrival I was informed that "we don't include breakfast you have to pay for it" On producing my hard copy the receptionist agreed that they would honour the deal.
reviews.title: Clean, modern, friendly staff, very close to Gatwick if you need to fly the nex day

description: 7 Hotel Diner is a brand new "budget/boutique" hotel in North Kent and Ideally situated just a short distance from the M25 Junction 4 we are the perfect destination for families, holiday makers business guests and uniquely car enthusiasts. We are not simply a hotel attached to a diner. Nor a diner attached to a hotel! We are a place to meet, to relax, do business, to dine, to unwind. Our aim is provide our guests with home from home comforts at affordable prices.
